newsitem.title: USA: Germany must continue spending cuts -- Tietmeyer.
newsitem.headline: Germany must continue spending cuts -- Tietmeyer.

text.p: Germany must and will continue its budget consolidation policies if interest rates are to remain low, providing scope for higher economic growth, Bundesbank president Hans Tietmeyer said on Tuesday.

In Germany's address to the annual meeting of the International Monetary Fund and World Bank, Tietmeyer said that the government had the firm intention of reducing public spending to rein in public deficits.

He added that the intention was to, "provide the basis for a reduction of the public deficit to below three percent of GDP so that Germany will fulfil the Maastricht criteria," referring to one of the economic conditions set for participation in European Economic and Monetary Union.

"Consolidation focusing on the expenditure side is a precondition for continued low interest rates and provides additional scope for investment and consumption and consequently for higher growth," Tietmeyer said.
